GOVERNOR DIRECTOR

Lauryn Ritchie
Let's Talk About it Girl's Home III
615 W. Lovell,
Kalamazoo, MI, 49007
Re: License #: CI390403045
SI #: 2025SIC0000262
Dear Lauryn Ritchie:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
427 East Alcott St.
Kalamazoo, MI 49001
(269) 251-2471
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000262
Special Investigation Intake Date: January 6, 2025
License #: CI390403045
Licensee Group Organization: Let's Talk About It CMH Services, PLLC
Licensee Designee: Tonya Moore
Chief Administrator: Lauryn Ritchie
Agency Name: Let's Talk About it Girl's Home III
Agency Address: 615 W. Lovell
Kalamazoo, MI 49007
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/17/2026
Capacity: 14
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
1/7/2025 Face to Face Documentation received; Entrance
Conference; Unannounced Visit;
Incident Notification; Special
Investigation Initiation; Interview
1/7/2025 Email Documentation received
1/7/2025 Email Documentation received
1/10/2025 Email Documentation received
1/13/2025 Email Documentation received

1/14/2025 Phone Interview

1/17/2025 Email Documentation received
1/21/2025 Email Documentation received
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A child was heard wailing and screaming saying "why would you
do that" (it is unknown what "that" was) while sounding like they
were in pain.
Additionally, the large window at the front is broken. It is unknown
how or when the window was broken.
Investigation Complainant was not interviewed since they reported
anonymously.
Administrator 1, Administrator 2, and Administrator 3 were
interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/2025. They
reported being aware of the incident since Law Enforcement was
called and responded. They also reported having a video
recording of much of the incident. They reported not being
present, but they did watch the video recording and noted Staff 2
and Staff 3 were working with the youth at the time. They
described the video as Youth A is observed walking to the front of
the building and punching a tree in the yard 3-times before
walking onto the porch. Once on the porch, Youth A walked to the
front picture window and punched the window causing the window
to break. After this action by Youth A, Youth A was observed
walking further along the porch and taking Youth A’s shirt off. Staff
2 was walking behind Youth A throughout this incident. Staff 3
stayed inside with the other youth (Youth B and Youth C) and
never came outside during the incident. They also reported Youth
D came onto the scene at this time and gave Youth A a hoodie to
put on. Youth A appeared to still be escalated and began to pick
up broken glass from the floor of the porch. It is viewed on the
video that Staff 2 was trying to de-escalate Youth A throughout the
time of the incident. After Youth A picked up a piece of glass,
Youth D was observed screaming “why would you do that” to
2

Youth A. They reported Staff 2 and Youth D both removed the
broken pieces of glass from Youth A’s hand.
They were asked about the use of a phone by youth and all three
responded that youth are allowed to use the phone especially if
the youth is having a crisis and every day of the week. They also
reported staff are coached on giving youth phone calls, especially
if escalated. They report having three estimates for repairing the
window and are taking the estimate that allows the window to be
replaced this week. They also reported one estimate was for no
repair for several weeks because of the size of the window.
Currently, the window is covered with plywood inside and outside
and covered with plastic to eliminate any drafts. Regarding Staff 3,
Administrator 1 reported giving Staff 3 some verbal coaching
about the tone of voice when interacting with youth. Administrator
1 also reported Staff 3 has never yelled at youth nor failed to
provide appropriate supervision. Administrator 1 finds Staff 3 to be
directive and assertive when dealing with the youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/2025.
She reported not being present at the time of the incident but
being one of the on-call who was notified by Staff 3 about the
incident. She also reported being told by Staff 3 that the incident
began when Staff 3 was going to take Youth C to urgent care at
Youth C’s request. Staff 3 reported having to take another youth
with her because their ratio is 1 staff to 2 youth and there were 2
staff on duty and 4 youth in the program. Staff 1 reported Staff 3
informed Staff 1 that Youth A and Youth D informed Staff 3 they
(Youth A and Youth D) didn’t want to go and started to become
escalated. Youth B was in Youth B’s room with a reported
“migraine headache”. Staff 1 reported Staff 4 came to the building
for support and transported Youth A and Youth B to the hospital.
Youth A went to the hospital because Youth A received a few
scratches from breaking the window. Staff 1 also reported Case
Manager came to the building to add additional support. Staff 1
reported getting to the building around 6 pm and the incident
occurred around 5:30 pm. Staff 1 knew nothing about the
screaming allegations.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/7/2025. Youth B reported being in Youth B’s room because of a
migraine headache but did hear window break and screaming.
Youth B was unable to recall what was said with the screaming.
Youth B also reported feeling safe at the facility and having staff
be attentive to Youth B.
3

Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/7/2025. Youth C reported needing to go to urgent care for a
medical issue which Youth C chose to avoid disclosing. Youth C
also reported not witnessing the breaking of the window but did
hear the window “shatter”. Youth C reported Youth A became
upset because Youth A was asked to go to urgent care with Youth
C and Staff 3. Youth C also reported feeling safe at the facility and
believes the program is helping Youth C make positive changes.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/2025.
She reported working the day of the incident and being present
when Youth A became escalated. She also reported the situation
began when Youth D became escalated when Youth D didn’t get
a phone call as quickly as Youth D was demanding. Staff 2
reported Staff 3 was dealing with Youth D and asking Youth D to
ask rather than demand to make a phone call. Staff 2 also
reported this interaction was the reason Youth A became
dysregulated and opened the kitchen door and banged the door
twice against the wall causing a hole in the wall. Youth A also
punched the wall before exiting the building and walking to the
front of the building. Staff 2 reported following Youth A to the front
of the building and observing Youth A punch a tree three times
before moving to the porch and punching the large picture
window. Staff 2 also reported trying to verbally deescalate Youth A
throughout the ordeal. Staff 2 reported Youth A picked up broken
glass after breaking the window and Staff 2 was able to take the
glass from Youth A’s hands. Youth A informed Staff 2 that Youth A
wanted to hurt Staff 3 with the glass because Youth D was upset.
Staff 2 reported that at this time, Youth D screamed “why would
you do that and why does everyone want to leave me”. It
appeared to Staff 2 that Youth D believed Youth A was going to
“kill herself”. Staff 2 also reported Staff 5 came on the scene at
that time and they switched so Staff 2 could go get her jacket.
Staff 2 reported Case Manager also came on the scene and both
Youth A and Youth D spoke with Clinician on the phone. Staff 2
also reported both Youth A, Youth D and all the staff (Staff 2, Staff
5, and Case Manager) went back inside of the building when
Youth A and Youth D calmed down.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/7/2025. Youth A reported being “triggered” by Staff 3 when Staff
3 told Youth A that Youth A should not be opening the back door
of the building. Youth A also reported this occurred before going
on an outing and Youth A was able to “let it go” and enjoy the
outing. Once back at the facility, Youth A reported being
“triggered” again when Youth D was not given a phone call as
4

soon as Youth D requested a phone call. Youth A also reported
believing Youth D was yelling so Youth A threw a chair and went
outside after breaking the back door. Youth A reported punching a
tree in the front yard before punching the picture window at the
front of the building. Youth A reported being angry at Staff 3
because Staff 3 didn’t allow Youth D a phone call quick enough,
so Youth A took off Youth A’s shirt and picked up a piece of glass
with a plan to hurt Staff 3. Youth A also reported the thought of
hurting Staff 3 just came to Youth A, but Youth A didn’t follow
through with it. Youth A reported feeling safe at the facility and
staff are attentive to Youth A’s needs. Youth A also reported the
program is helping Youth A make positive changes. Youth A
reported receiving weekly individual and group therapy which is
helpful.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/7/2025. Youth D reported being present during the allegations
and witnessing part of the incident. Youth D also reported the
incident began when Youth A was asked to go to urgent care and
became upset. Youth D believes Youth A is fearful of going to the
hospital and heard Youth A say, “I don’t want to go back”. Youth D
reported at this time, Youth D became upset because Youth A
was getting louder. Youth D also reported going into the bathroom
when Youth D heard Youth A leave the building. Youth D went
after Youth A because Youth D believed Youth A didn’t have
shoes on. Youth D reported getting to the front of the building right
after Youth A punched the picture window. Youth D also reported
Youth A picked up a piece of glass that Youth A took from Youth
D and yelled “why would you do that” thinking that Youth A was
going to self-harm. Youth D reported not remembering much
because Youth D “blacked out”. Youth D also reported feeling safe
at the facility and staff are always watching the youth. Staff are
also supportive towards the youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/2025.
Staff 3 reported the incident began when Youth C was having an
unidentified medical issue and needed to be taken to urgent care.
Staff 3 also reported because of the level of care being provided
at the facility and to keep staff in ratio another one of the youth
would have to go along with Youth C and Staff 3. Because Youth
B was in Youth B’s room with a migraine headache, either Youth
A or Youth D would need to go. Youth C was on the phone
speaking with Administrator 1 about the need to go to urgent care
when Youth D came downstairs asking for a support call. Staff 3
informed Youth C that Youth D needed to use the phone and
when this didn’t occur fast enough, Youth D began to escalate and
5

demand the phone call. Youth D also began to say Youth D was
being denied a support call. Youth D was yelling at Staff 3 when
Staff 2 began to interact. Staff 2 began speaking to Youth D to
deescalate Youth D when Youth D grabbed the phone from Staff 2
and left the room. Staff 3 reported Youth A was witness to these
interactions and became upset. Staff 3 also reported Youth A went
out the back door followed by Staff 2. Staff 3 reported calling
Administrator 1 to inform her of the situation when Staff 3 heard
the window break in the front of the building. Staff 3 also reported
calling Clinician who told Staff 3, Clinician would help deescalate
Youth A over the phone. Staff 3 gave the phone to Staff 2 who
was with Youth A and Youth D. Staff 3 reported Case Manager
showed up around this time to help support staff. Administrator 1
called back and informed staff that Youth B and Youth C would be
going to urgent care, so Staff 3 took Youth B and Youth C to
urgent care. Staff 3 reported receiving training on techniques to
deescalate youth and training on developing healthy relationships
with the youth. Staff 3 also reported Staff 3’s relationship with
Youth D is not the “greatest” and Staff 3 will avoid being the direct
staff for Youth D to help keep things calm by having Youth D work
with staff Youth D likes. Staff 3 reported having no discipline since
working at the facility.
Case Manager was interviewed via phone on 1/14/2025. He
reported not being present when the incident occurred but
showing up a few minutes after the window had been broken by
Youth A. He also reported when arriving at the facility, he found
Youth A, Youth D, and Staff 2 all on the porch of the building.
Case Manager tried to speak with Youth D, but Youth D refused to
speak with him. Youth A went on a walk with Staff 2 and Youth B
and Youth C went to urgent care with Staff 3 while Youth D
remained at the facility with Case Manager.
Clinician was interviewed via phone on 1/14/2025. She
reported receiving a call from the facility the day of the incident
and right after the window was broken. She also reported
speaking to Youth A and Youth D over the phone and working on
helping Youth A and Youth D deescalate and calm themselves
(Youth A and Youth D) down. Clinician reported Youth A was able
to calm down and shared that Youth A was upset over Youth D
being upset because Youth A was concerned about Youth D. She
also reported providing individual and group therapy to the youth
(Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D) at the facility. She
reported working with the staff at the facility (includes Staff 2 and
Staff 3) on de-escalation techniques and how to interaction with
youth when youth become dysregulated. The focus of the therapy
6

the youth received is based on Dialectical behavioral therapy
(DBT).
Executive Assistant was interviewed via phone on 1/14/2025.
She reported arriving at the facility just as Youth A, followed by
Staff 2 were walking towards the road. She also reported Youth D
was following behind Youth A and Staff 2. Executive Assistant
went into the building and was dropping off food in the kitchen
when hearing something break from the front of the building. She
reported leaving the kitchen and going outside. She also walked
towards the front of the building and observed the plate glass
window in the front of the building had been broken. Youth A and
Youth D were sitting next to each other on the porch and Youth D
was crying. Executive Assistant reported Clinician called and
spoke with Youth A. Because Staff 2 was present without a coat,
Executive Assistant asked Staff 2 to go into the building to get a
coat and she (Executive Assistant) would supervise Youth A and
Youth D. Executive Assistant also asked if Youth A and Youth D
would like their coats and both reported not wanting a coat. She
reported not observing any injuries on Youth A nor Youth D. Once
Staff 2 return, Executive Assistant went back into the building. She
reported speaking with Staff 3 who was upset and tearful and
informed Executive Assistant that Youth A and Youth D were
being disrespectful toward Staff 3.
House Manager was interviewed via phone on 1/17/2025. He
reported receiving a phone call from Administrator 1 about the
incident and arrived at the facility around 6:30 pm. He also
reported upon arriving he observed Youth A and Youth D being
calm. He also reported he is on-call and responds to emergency
situations such as this. House Manager reported the window was
repaired three days after the incident. He also reported Staff 2 and
Staff 3 followed Youth A’s safety plan during the incident as
reported by Staff 2 and Staff 3.
Video review:
The first video recording (split screen) has views from the
front of the house on to the porch. Camera 2’s view is more
towards the front yard with some of the porch in view. Camera 1’s
view is more from the side facing back towards the house and the
left side of the porch. In Camera 2 Youth A is observed walking
down the sidewalk followed by Staff 2. Youth A walked to a tree
between the sideway and street and appears to punch the tree
(unable to view the actual punch). Youth A then walks up on the
7

porch towards the center picture window and appears to punch
the window. Staff 2 is right behind Youth A. Youth A then walks to
the left side of the porch again followed by Staff 2 and Youth D is
observed walking up on the porch. Youth D walks up to Youth A
and grabbed Youth A’s arm while Staff 2 stands a few feet away.
Youth A takes off Youth A’s sweatshirt and Youth D picks it up
and helps Youth A put the sweatshirt back on. The three walk over
to the broken window. The video ends with Youth D walking away
and further left on the porch.
The second video view is of the left side of the porch. It begins
with a view of Youth D standing on the right side of the frame.
Only part of Staff 2 can be seen, and Youth D is standing with
Youth D’s hands over Youth D’s mouth. Youth D pulls Youth A
into the picture and towards the left side of the porch. Staff 2 is
standing behind Youth A. Youth A then sits down on the porch
with Staff 2 kneeling in front of Youth A and Youth D standing in
front of Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident Report for Youth A dated 1/4/2025. This document
outlines this incident was noted as “violent, behavior, aggression
(physical and/or verbal). It is documented that Youth A became
upset when Youth D began yelling and informed Staff 3 that Youth
A was feeling misunderstood. Youth A is documented as grabbing
a chair and throwing it against the wall in the kitchen. Youth A is
then documented as slamming the kitchen door against the wall
twice, putting a hole in the wall. Documentation indicates Youth A
then walked to the front of the building where Youth A punched a
tree twice, walked up on the porch and punched the large window,
breaking the window. Youth A is documented as throwing a
table/chair on the porch while threatening Staff 3. Youth A then
took off Youth A’s hoodie exposing Youth A’s bra, but Staff 2 and
Youth D were able to help Youth A put the hoodie back on. It is
documented that Youth A then attempted to pick up glass from the
broken window while making comments about self-harm/suicide.
Documentation indicates Youth A then began to calm down and
was able to speak with Clinician by phone. Interventions used are
documented as walking, listening to music, and 1:1 conversation.
Documentation indicates Youth A refused medical treatment but
did accept tice for Youth A’s hand used to punch items.
Hospital Referral Recommendation and Crisis Safety Plan for
Youth A dated 9/25/24. This document outlines reminders such
as means of self-harm are secured by staff and Youth A is
8

prevented from accessing them, keep all recommended
appointments, take medication as prescribed, and notify the PCP
if Youth A experiences any side effects from medication. Triggers
or Stressors are documented as Youth A feeling overwhelmed
and Youth A is to use Youth A’s mood diary, use creative outlets,
and recognize thinking errors. Warning signs are documented as
self-harm behaviors, walking off, and aggressively shaking Youth
A’s leg. Three individuals are listed as people Youth A can contact
for help.
Person Centered Safety Plan for Youth A dated 9/19/24. This
document outlines Youth A’s baseline behaviors as happy, not
mean, smiling, talkative, and engaged. Triggers are documented
as being lied to and ignored, someone being mistreated, and
asked to engage in certain physical activities like cardio. Warning
signs are documented as Youth A becoming quiet, shaking,
watery eyes, and skin turning read. Youth A will also experience
high feelings of doubt and not belonging. Coping skills are
documented as Youth A asking to go to sensory room, go outside,
draw, paint, talk about situation, take a cold bath, engage in
activities that take Youth A’s mind off the situation. Two support
individuals are documented on this form.
Family Safety Plan for Youth A dated 1/10/25. This document
outlines a proactive safety plan which involves, going to Youth A’s
room or walking away, playing music and cold water, take
medications as prescribed, attend weekly therapy, attend
Psychiatrist’s visits, take a bath, step outside, journal, and use
coping skills. The reactive safety plan is documented as
contacting Kalamazoo mobile crisis, contacting police, contacting
grandma or stepdad, and contacting foster care worker.
Let’s Talk About It Policy for “no touch” dated 2/10/21. The
purpose of this policy is documented as a policy for addressing
escalated behaviors. Staff are not to touch youth at any time. Staff
are to use only verbal de-escalation techniques with escalated
youth. Staff are to call on-call staff for additional support and tap
out with a coworker if needed. Youth are also not to touch staff nor
other youth. The only type of touch permitted are, fist bumps,
handshakes, high fives, elbow taps and side hugs.
Let’s Talk About It Policy for “on-call protocol” dated 11/2023.
The purpose of this policy is documented as an effort to maximize
and deliver a high quality of service to the youth in the program.
Staff that are part of the leadership team are expected to be
9

available for an on-call rotation. On-call staff are expected to
respond within 15-minutes of receiving a call or text message.
Staff 1’s personnel file was reviewed. Documentation indicates
she was hired on 11/14/2024 and there is no disciplinary action
documented in the file. Documentation also indicates, she is
current on her required training.
Tour Observation:
A walk-through was completed. This is a three-story older
structure close to downtown Kalamazoo, Michigan. The facility is
clean and maintained. The large picture window in the front of the
building was broken and covered over with a sheet of plywood on
the outside and a sheet of plywood on the inside. There is also
plastic over the plywood and window frame on the inside of the
house and this has removed any possible draft. All of the glass
has been removed from the floor of the porch and inside the
facility living room. There is damage to the wall behind the kitchen
door and the facility will repair this as soon as possible. This
damage does not pose a threat to the youth in the program.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as evidence by interviews with
staff, youth, written documentation and video recording. Currently
and during the incident, the facility had a staffing ratio of 1 staff for
every 2 youth. The on-call staff responded and were able to
provide support to the other staff and youth. The facility is
providing appropriate training to staff to help them develop de-
escalation techniques focusing on trauma information.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
10

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
1/22/2025
______________________________________
Paul Fatato Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
1/30/2025

Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
